reviewText: You should have seen the episode where Naruto gets the message from his father left in the nine-tails seal. This story happens before that though. In a way, long before that. You get to see a bit of the fourth Hokage in action, which is cool. The story itself is "very Naruto". The ending credits are stills that continue the story so don't stop at the end. It can be a little confusing until you think it out. (Or mayby I'm just slow!). I only gave it 4 stars because it does get a little hard to follow and Viz's tendency not to give translations of Kanji on the screen. It's actually excellent, one of the better movies to date.
summary: Good movie, but a little hard to place in the series
Title: Naruto Shippuden Movie: The Lost Tower (Naruto Movie #7, Shippuden Part 4)

reviewText: This is in Japaneses with sub titles. It will be great in English when it comes out but Naruto is great in its original language.Give it a try .

reviewText: This one is my favorite for the simple fact that Naruto gets to go back in time and actually meet his dad, even if he never realizes it's his dad until the last possible second.  Great action and a new/different version of the Rasengan are seen and it's pretty darn epic.
summary: My favorite of the current movies
Title: Naruto Shippuden Movie: The Lost Tower (Naruto Movie #7, Shippuden Part 4)

reviewText: this movie was well written and great action going back to the past was cool when naruto meets his father and young kakashi this movie was longer than the previous 3 movies and original naruto feature movies as well 4 stars cause its everything u want in a ninja anime movie to all fans this is the best story telling movie u can get from naruto yet
summary: this 4th naruto shippuden movie feature was the longest and great story and message to me it was like forever

reviewText: Ok, so im one of those people that actually wait for the dvd release in order to see the film. By saying this i mean i havent see the next 2 movies (Blood Prison and RTN). So this review is based on the dvd.Synopsis: Naruto, Sakura, Yamato and Sai are assigned by Tsunade to go capture a rogue ninja named Mukade in the city of Loran. During the fight Mukade summons forth the power of the "Ley line" an ancient underground channel chakra. Naruto gets caught up in the chakra and is sent back in time in the city of Loran. There he encounters the Queen of Loran, Sara, whose rule is threatened. Naruto must help the girl regain her right to her people as well to find a meaning to what has happened to the city. Along the way he will encounter some unexpected characters and will give a true meaning in the words "Never Give Up!".Dvd: Viz media this time around actually made some new features for this. For starters we have music to the menu! Also in "extras" you have 3 trailers for Naruto Shippuden: The Movie, Naruto Shippuden The Movie: Bonds and Naruto Shippuden The Movie: The Will of Fire. 4 trailer of all the Bleach movies. And 2 trailers of the upcoming movie Naruto Shippuden The Movie: Blood Prison. Last and best we get a short animation called Naruto and the three wishes. A comedy episode that last 15 minutes!Overall i give the movie 9/10 for its plot which i loved and for the great action scenes and if you love the action scenes in Naruto this movie wont disappoint! Highly recommended to all Naruto fans!!
summary: Best Naruto Movie i've seen so far!
Title: Naruto Shippuden Movie: The Lost Tower (Naruto Movie #7, Shippuden Part 4)
